question: Six hundred adult Americans were asked by telephone poll, 'What do you think constitutes a middle-class income?' The results are in Table 2.71. Also, include left endpoint, but not the right endpoint. <image 1> What percentage of the survey answered 'not sure'?
description:
The image is a table titled "Table 2.71" which lists salary ranges and their corresponding relative frequencies. The table has two columns: "Salary ($)" and "Relative frequency." The salary ranges and their relative frequencies are as follows:

- Salary range: < 20,000, Relative frequency: 0.02
- Salary range: 20,000–25,000, Relative frequency: 0.09
- Salary range: 25,000–30,000, Relative frequency: 0.19
- Salary range: 30,000–40,000, Relative frequency: 0.26
- Salary range: 40,000–50,000, Relative frequency: 0.18
- Salary range: 50,000–75,000, Relative frequency: 0.17
- Salary range: 75,000–99,999, Relative frequency: 0.02
- Salary range: 100,000+, Relative frequency: 0.01

The question asks for the percentage of the survey respondents who answered "not sure," but this information is not provided in the table.
